text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
In the evening, when he returns from work, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining three floors to his apartment.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days.
Let me break down the information given and see if I can come up with a logical explanation.
First, the man lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
That makes sense because it's efficient—he doesn't have to climb up 10 flights of stairs each morning.
In the evening, when he returns from work, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor and then walks up the remaining three floors to his apartment.
So, on normal days, he goes from ground floor to 7th floor by elevator and then walks up 3 floors.
But on rainy days, he changes his routine.
Instead of getting off at the 7th floor, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
Why would he do that? Maybe there's something about the rain that makes him prefer going all the way up instead of walking up the stairs.
Let me think about the possible reasons.
One possibility is that walking up the stairs on rainy days is less convenient.
Maybe the stairs are slippery when it's raining, so he prefers to take the elevator all the way to avoid getting wet or slipping.
That makes sense because walking on wet stairs can be dangerous, especially if they're not well-maintained or if he's in a hurry.
Another angle could be that the elevator is faster or more comfortable.
However, on normal days, he takes the elevator only to the 7th floor, so it's not about speed or comfort on rainy days specifically.
It seems more like a practicality issue.
Also, maybe the building's design or the elevator's operation changes on rainy days, but that seems less likely.
It's more probable that it's a personal preference to avoid the stairs in bad weather.
So, putting it all together, it's likely that on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor to avoid walking up the wet and potentially slippery stairs.
This would explain why he changes his routine only on rainy days.

</think>

He takes the elevator to the 10th floor on rainy days because the stairs are slippery, making walking up unsafe.
